Business Development Executive Job at Biz Afric Solutions




        
    

        
        Biz Afric Solutions - Our Client is a fast-growing interior decoration business focused on transforming home and office spaces into aesthetically pleasing environments without the need for structural alterations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid – field and remote work)
Reports to: Business Owner

Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a proactive and organized business development executive to spearhead our business growth efforts, grow our customer base, and drive revenue growth through strategic outreach, campaigns, and partnerships.


Key Responsibilities


	Prospect and contact potential clients (homeowners, offices, Airbnb hosts).
	Build relationships with real estate agents, developers, and property brokers to generate leads.
	Maintain and update a database of prospects and actively follow up on inquiries.
	Develop and manage a structured referral system for past clients and partners.
	Track and process referral rewards (commission tiers 10–20%)
	Email Marketing: Design and send weekly newsletters showcasing project transformations, promotions, and client testimonials
	Social Media: Create and post engaging content (before/after photos, trends, design tips) across Instagram, Facebook, and Pinterest.
	Paid Ads: Run Facebook/Instagram ad campaigns and optimise performance for ROI.
	SEO & Google My Business: Manage listings and ensure content is optimised for local search visibility.
	Build a segmented contact list and send bulk SMS messages monthly for offers, project features, or event promos.
	Maintain and update the business’s design portfolio for online use and client presentations
	Collect testimonials and turn successful projects into short case studies for marketin
	Identify and attend relevant expos, home & lifestyle fairs, or networking events.
	Establish collaboration with furniture stores, interior accessory vendors, and property developers.
	Represent the brand at in-person events, promoting services and generating leads.


Success in This Role Looks Like


	Consistently generating quality leads and converting them into paying clients.
	Increasing our online engagement and social media reach.
	Building a pipeline of partnerships that feed consistent business.
	Helping the business hit its ?1M monthly revenue target within 6 months.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.
	1 - 2 years of experience in digital marketing, field marketing, or client acquisition roles.
	Proficiency in digital tools: Canva, Mailchimp (or similar), Meta Business Suite, Excel/Google Sheets.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Confidence in attending events and engaging with clients in person.
	Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple campaigns simultaneously.
	Interest in interior design or lifestyle branding is a plus.


Perks


	Salary: N140,000 - N180,000 monthly (with commissions)
	Opportunity to grow within a creative and expanding company.
	Hands-on exposure to both digital and offline marketing techniques.
	Bonuses based on performance and results.

title: Job Vacancies at Ardova Plc
content:
Ardova Plc is a Nigerian leading indigenous and integrated energy company involved in the distribution of petroleum products. With an extensive network of over 450 retail outlets in Nigeria and significant storage facilities in Apapa, Lagos and Onne, Rivers State, we procure and distribute petrol (PMS), diesel (AGO), kerosene (DPK) and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG). Our services also involve the manufacturing and distribution of a wide range of quality lubricants from our oil blending plant in Apapa, Lagos. These lubricants include: Super V, Visco 2000 and Diesel Motor Oil. We are also the sole authorised distributor of Shell branded Helix Engine Oils in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Team Lead, LPG Retail Sales

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The role holder is responsible for driving revenue growth, expanding customer relationship, and identifying new business opportunities.


Job Details


	Analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitor activities to identify opportunities and challenges in the LPG business
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients, distributors, and stakeholders. 
	Identify customer needs, provide product information, and offer solutions to enhance customer satisfaction. 
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities to expand the market presence.
	Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics
	Prepare regular reports on sales activities, market trends, and competitor activities.
	Maintain minimum stock of LPG at retail outlet and LPG plants being covered.


Requirements
Education:


	A Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Mathematics, Business Administration, or related field with a minimum of 2.2.


Experience:


	5-8 years of relevant experience in Business Development, Sales, Marketing etc. Previous experience in an LPG sales role is paramount
	Relevant professional certification and post graduate degree is an added advantage


Skills:


	Good understanding of the local and international Oil & Gas sector including guiding principles and regulations.
	Good knowledge of marketing operations in the downstream oil and gas marketing sector.
	Influential leadership and stakeholder management.
	Critical thinking and problem-solving with a results-driven mindset.
	Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to adapt to changing environments.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Business Manager (Retail) - North

Job Location: Kano
Job Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Optimization of company’s assets for sales and marketing of all company‘s products across the retail outlets and providing leadership to the Retail Marketing Associates within the region to deliver set targets.
	The job holder is charged with coordinating sales activities, development and implementation of strategies and plans to achieve expected levels of sales at the retail outlets across designated region.


Job Details


	Business development of the company operated outlets in the region.
	Lead the drive for the growth of AP’s market share in the region 
	Ensure compliance is maintained with AP’s policies in operation area.
	Deliver on volume, revenue, profit and OPEX set targets 
	Provide leadership to the team to foster collaboration needed to function as a unit.
	Drive regulatory compliance within area of operation.
	Set budgets and conduct periodic performance appraisal for Retail Marketing Associates 
	Ensure compliance with HSE standards across all retail outlets in the region
	Liaise with Terminal operations and fleet to ensure product availability and optimal stock quantities for the stations
	Propose product prices to drive profitability and revenue.     
	Keep abreast of industry and market trends, as well as competition at the regional level to support strategic decision making
	Drive the deployment of effective strategies to increase footfall at the retail outlets and strengthen the brand.


Requirements
Education:


	A Bachelor's Degree with a minimum of a 2.2 in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.


Experience:


	7-10 years of relevant experience.


Skills:


	Able to present and express information effectively and also responds positively to feedback
	Good knowledge of Ardova’s products and services
	Good customer service, relationship management tools, networking/teaming skills
	Good understanding of the local and international Oil & Gas sector including guiding principles and regulations. Good knowledge of marketing operations in the downstream oil and gas marketing sector.
	Thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.
	Applies innovative solutions to problems and improve internal processes. 
	Good people management skills, supervisory, coaching and mentoring skills.


Benefits
Financial Benefits:


	Competitive Compensation: Receive a generous salary for your work
	Transport Stipend/ Fueling Allowance: Additional financial support for your daily commute 
	13th Month Allowances: Receive an extra boost at the end of the year
	Leave Allowances: Financial support to maintain a healthy work-life balance


Non-Financial Benefits:


	Comprehensive HMO Coverage: For employee, spouse, and up to four children
	Paid Time Off: Generous annual, parental, study, compassionate, and exam leave.
	Complimentary Lunch: Stay fueled and energized during work hours.


Application Closing Date: 14th October, 2025.

Job Position:&nbsp;Human Resource Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Group Head, Human Resources &amp; General Services

Role Summary


	As part of our growth strategy, we are seeking a strategic and hands-on Human Resource Manager to lead the people operations &mdash; driving HR strategy while managing the day-to-day HR functions that power our innovation-driven culture.
	The Human Resource Manager will be responsible for shaping the organization&rsquo;s HR strategy and ensuring smooth daily operations across the entire employee lifecycle &mdash; from recruitment and onboarding to performance management, learning &amp; development, and retention.
	The ideal candidate will have experience working in a fast-paced technology environment, where agility, innovation, and people excellence drive success.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership:


	Develop and execute a forward-thinking HR strategy aligned with the company&rsquo;s business and technology objectives.
	Partner with executive leadership on workforce planning, talent management, and organizational design to support scalability and innovation.
	Champion a high-performance culture, embedding metrics-driven HR practices and continuous improvement initiatives.
	Drive culture transformation, engagement, and change management programs to sustain innovation and teamwork across hybrid and cross-functional teams.
	Utilize data analytics and HR metrics to provide insights and recommendations to senior management.


Operational Leadership (Day-to-Day HR Functions):


	Lead and manage end-to-end recruitment and talent acquisition, with a focus on sourcing technical and IT-skilled professionals.
	Oversee onboarding and induction programs to ensure seamless integration of new hires into the organization.
	Manage the performance management cycle, including goal setting, appraisals, and performance improvement plans.
	Develop and implement learning and development programs that strengthen both technical and soft skills within the organization.
	Supervise compensation and benefits, ensuring competitiveness, fairness, and compliance.
	Handle employee relations, grievance resolution, and disciplinary procedures with tact and professionalism.
	Ensure compliance with labour laws, company policies, and data protection regulations.
	Manage HR systems and technology tools (HRIS, ATS, LMS) to enhance operational efficiency.
	Maintain up-to-date HR records and produce monthly HR analytics and reports for management decision-making.
	Supervise and mentor HR team members to ensure consistent delivery of HR services.


Performance Metrics (KPIs)


	Time-to-fill for technical and non-technical roles.
	Employee retention and engagement rate.
	% completion of performance appraisals on schedule.
	Training participation rate and skill improvement metrics.
	HR process efficiency and compliance rate.
	HR data accuracy and reporting quality.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s&nbsp;Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related fields
	Minimum of 8&ndash;10 years of progressive HR experience, including at least 3 years in a senior HR management or strategic role (preferably within IT, technology, or service industries).
	Master&rsquo;s degree or MBA is an added advantage.
	Professional certification (CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, or equivalent) is highly desirable.
	Demonstrated experience in managing HR in a tech-driven or project-based environment.
	Strong understanding of modern HR systems, talent analytics, and agile HR practices.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Proven ability to balance strategic HR planning with hands-on operational delivery.


Core Competencies:


	Strategic Thinking and Business Acumen
	Tech Talent Management
	Performance and Change Management
	Employee Relations and Coaching
	HR Data Analytics and Systems Proficiency
	Emotional Intelligence and People Leadership
	Agility, Confidentiality, and Integrity.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to lead HR strategy in a fast-growing tech ecosystem.
	Exposure to cutting-edge digital and cloud technologies.
	Competitive compensation and benefits package.
	Dynamic, inclusive, and innovation-driven culture.
	Career growth and continuous learning opportunities.

title: Job Openings at Ernst & Young (EY)
content:
Ernst & Young (EY) is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Officer, Global Compliance and Reporting (GCR)

Requisition ID: 1651565
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	In EY Tax, you’ll have the opportunity to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex tax obligations around the world.
	You’ll get a unique glimpse deep inside a company’s business and become a trusted advisor, working collaboratively on a team that influences major business decisions.
	Demand has made this a rapidly growing area, and the relationships we build here translate into big business in other areas, making this a true priority. 


The opportunity


	As a senior in Tax, you will be a part of our Diversified Staff Group.
	Our Diversified Staff Group model is all about providing our people with the skills, information and knowledge to take on some of the biggest challenges in taxation.
	The vision of EY’s Diversified Staff Group (DSG) is to grow today’s tax professionals to be tomorrow’s leaders.
	You can expect a unique insight into our business, where you’ll build a network of relationships in an area that influences major business decisions every day.
	As the team continues to grow, so will you, and over time, you will become a well-rounded tax professional with broad experience in multiple areas of tax.


Your Key Responsibilities


	Your role as a Tax Senior will give you the opportunity to combine corporate tax work with structured and virtual learning.
	Our curriculum will build your career in tax; includes work experience in tax compliance, tax accrual reviews, tax provisions and tax planning.
	Our people work on key client issues in domestic corporate income taxation, with a focus on implementing tax strategies that align with the client's business objectives.


Skills and Attributes for Success:


	Contribute to client satisfaction by providing clients with quality, timely and responsive services and work products.
	Demonstrate an understanding of increasingly complex tax concepts.
	Discuss moderately complex tax issues with the engagement team and client management.
	Keep informed of current tax developments and effectively apply tax knowledge to client situations. Thoroughly and accurately analyze information.
	Prepare practical and effective approaches to the client's tax situation and arrive at appropriate conclusions.
	Preparing corporate tax returns
	Auditing tax provisions
	Share tax planning ideas with others.
	Participate in and contribute to achieving team goals.
	Assist in the development of recommendations and implementation plans and assist in making quality decisions in complex areas.


Requirements
To qualify for the role you must have


	Either:
	
		A Bachelor's Degree, preferably with an emphasis in accounting, finance, or a related field
	
	
	Either:
	
		Attained or close to qualifying for an accounting designation (CPA or equivalent) or Completed or enrolled in a Masters of Taxation program.
	
	
	Exceptional PC proficiency including Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
	The ability to manage time spent against budget and work alongside team members to ensure the timely completion of exceptional client service
	Excellent managerial, organizational, and verbal/written communication skills


Ideally, you’ll also have:


	A passionate interest in developing tax knowledge
	A desire to work in an environment with learning opportunities on a daily basis


What we look for:


	We’re interested in strong team players who support their colleagues in reaching their goals while also considering their own workload and development.
	We’re looking for people with a genuine passion for tax, and the future of tax, and are inspired to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex tax obligations around the world.
	If you have the confidence to speak up and influence a team that affects big businesses worldwide, this role is for you.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Manager, Regulatory Compliance

Requisition ID: 1592302
Job Location: Lagos

The Opportunity


	As a Regulatory Compliance Manager, you will be a part of our Regulatory and Company Secretarial team. 
	You will be part of a team who identifies planning opportunities to help clients fulfill compliance responsibilities, avoid penalties as well as minimize compliance burdens.
	This position offers excellent opportunities for teaming, leadership, and career advancement to the right candidate.


Your Key Responsibilities


	As a manager, you will advise on multiple and challenging Regulatory advisory and compliance engagements and to contribute to the delivery of innovative solutions and regulatory planning ideas for our diverse clients.


To qualify for the role, you must have


	Bachelor’s Degree in Law (at least a second-class upper division)
	Minimum of 8 years of relevant regulatory compliance experience or equivalent experience in business or industry
	Excellent managerial, organizational and communication skills.


Skills and attributes for success:


	Supporting the business to identify and reach out to potential clients
	Undertaking legal and regulatory research and assess and evaluate the impact of changes in applicable legislation and best international practices
	Suggesting and implementing practical and innovative solutions to clients and reaching relevant conclusions
	Leading development of recommendations and solution implementation plans and using professional judgment in making informed decisions on complex compliance issues
	Identifying opportunities to sell regulatory advisory and compliance services
	Maintaining effective client relationships
	Developing and sustaining strategic relationships with industry stakeholders, including regulators to deliver on client projects
	Participating and assisting in reaching client service team goals
	Collaborating on business development initiatives in specific industries targeting practice growth
	Drafting regulatory alerts, thought leadership materials about changes to legislation and regulations or following policy statements or judgements
	Coordinating a program of training and capacity-building activities for the team covering all key areas of compliance and regulatory developments
	Identifying, understanding, and escalating clients’ compliance risk events/issues in a timely manner and focusing on fixing the root causes of the issues.
	Monitoring the implementation status of agreed-upon action points aimed at driving compliance
	Managing clients’ compliance obligations
	Supporting clients in regulatory compliance, including the timely preparation and submission of regulatory filings such as annual returns, or a timely response to regulatory circulars.


Ideally, you'll also have:


	The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, professional services environment
	Mature, proactive, committed, highly motivated and driven team player.


Salary
Competitive.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Manager - Global Compliance and Reporting (GCR)

Requisition ID: 1593129
Job Location: Lagos

Role Overview


	The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring compliance with local and international tax regulations, providing tax audit and controversy support services, and preparing various financial reports.
	This position encompasses a wide range of service offerings within the GCR Unit for Non-oil companies.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare, review and submit tax returns in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Identify and mitigate tax-related risks, implementing robust controls and processes.
	Provide support in Tax Controversy matters, assisting clients in navigating disputes with tax authorities.
	Handle Income Tax Compliance, ensuring accurate reporting and adherence to local and international tax laws.
	Manage Tax Accounting, Provisioning, and Reporting, ensuring accurate tax provisions and compliance with relevant standards.
	Manage Accounting Compliance & Reporting (ACR) processes, ensuring all compliance obligations are met.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual accounting reports according to International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), include compilation of annual statutory reports in line with IFRS provisions.
	Oversee Payroll Operations, ensuring compliance with payroll tax regulations and timely submissions.
	Lead and mentor a team of tax professionals, promoting a collaborative culture.
	Collaborate with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions across all service offerings.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree (BSc/HND) in Accounting, Finance, Law, or a related field (minimum of 2.1/upper credit).
	4 - 6 years of relevant experience in tax and accounting compliance & reporting, with a strong track record in a senior role.
	Professional or postgraduate qualifications (ICAN, ACCA, CITN, MBA) are advantageous.
	Strong knowledge of local and international tax regulations and IFRS.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to manage multiple clientsand projects simultaneously.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	A knowledge of Oil and Gas is an Added advantage. 


Salary
Competitive.

Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply
